purpose: Enable employees to request company-approved devices through a self-service Power App, triggering approval workflows and integrating with internal policies.

mvp_components.name: Device Catalog
mvp_components.details: Allows employees to browse available devices, view specs, photos, availability, and filter by department-approved models.

mvp_components.name: Order Request Form
mvp_components.details: Form for device selection, business need justification, urgency level selection, and auto-population of employee details from Azure AD.

mvp_components.name: Approval Workflow
mvp_components.details: Workflow for managers to receive notifications, approve/reject requests with comments within a 2 business day SLA.

post_mvp_modules.name: Request Tracking
post_mvp_modules.details: Allows employees to view status of their requests and receive email notifications at each step. Optional Power BI dashboard for tracking.

post_mvp_modules.name: Inventory Management
post_mvp_modules.details: Enables IT Admin to update stock levels, mark orders as fulfilled, and link to procurement system like SAP.

constraints: Must use Power Apps Canvas App
Data must be stored in Dataverse
Approval process must use Power Automate
Device models filtered by department policy
App must support desktop + mobile usage
No external users (internal only via Azure AD)
integration_points: Power Automate for approvals and notifications
Procurement system (e.g., SAP) for inventory management (Post-MVP)
notes: The app should have a clean, corporate design with device images, a responsive layout for phone and desktop, use dropdowns, cards, and status icons, and include a confirm order screen before submission. It must also be accessible (WCAG AA).
